case_vignette:
A 70-year-old man presents with 1 year of a non-healing growth on the right cheek. He says he first noticed it when he accidentally bumped into it and it bled easily. He denies any preceding trauma to the lesion. The patient has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He is a nonsmoker and has never used tobacco products. He has a family history of skin cancer. The patient is a retired accountant and has spent most of his life working indoors. He has a history of sunburns as a child, but has not had any sunburns in the least 20 years. He has a history of skin cancer in his family, with his mother and sister both having had basal cell carcinoma. The patient is concerned about the growth and wants to know if it is cancerous.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a non-healing growth on my right cheek that I first noticed a year ago, which easily bled when I accidentally bumped into it.
Has the growth changed in size, color, or shape since you first noticed it?
No, I haven't noticed a change in size, color, or shape since I first noticed the growth.
Do you have any history of excessive sun exposure or use of tanning beds?
I have a history of sunburns as a child, but I haven't had any sunburns in the last 20 years, and I've spent most of my life working indoors.
Do you have any other similar growths on your body?
No, I don't have any other similar growths on my body.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer or any other skin conditions?
Yes, I have a family history of skin cancer; both my mother and sister had basal cell carcinoma.
Final Diagnosis: Basal Cell Carcinoma
